#Text=Joe Isgro
#Text=Joe Isgro
#Text=( born c. 1948 [ 1 ] ) is an American Academy Award -nominated producer and Purple Heart veteran .
#Text=Early life
#Text=He was born in Philadelphia , Pennsylvania .
#Text=He enlisted in the U.S. Marine Corps and at the age of 19 , he was presented with a Purple Heart for his bravery and wounds received during combat in the Vietnam War .
#Text=His term with the Marines ended in 1968 . [ 2 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Isgro 's career began as local promotion director for Decca Records ( which later became MCA Records ) .
#Text=His responsibilities included record promotion of various artists for the Pennsylvania and New Jersey territories .
#Text=Some of these artists included Neil Diamond , Murray Head , Jesus Christ Superstar , Sonny & Cher , The Who and Elton John .
#Text=In 1970 , Isgro went to work for Paramount Records as the regional promoter , working with such artists as Billy Joel , Dave Mason and The Crusaders .
#Text=Isgro then went to work for Schwartz Bros. , the largest independent record distributor whose clients included Motown , A&M Records , RCA Records , Chrysalis Records and Arista Records .
#Text=In 1974 , Roulette Records hired Joe as the National Director of Promotion .
#Text=Isgro led the promotional staff and oversaw the company 's publicity and advertising department . [ 3 ]
#Text=Motown Records
#Text=hired Isgro in 1976 as Regional Director of Promotion .

#Text=He was responsible for the promotion and development of Diana Ross , Stevie Wonder , Marvin Gaye , Smokey Robinson , The Temptations , Lionel Richie , The Jacksons , The Commodores , Thelma Houston and Teena Marie .
#Text=In the years to follow , Joe was promoted to National Director of Promotion , which brought him to California , and then to Executive Vice President of Promotion . [ 4 ]
#Text=After several years with Motown , Isgro left and became involved in the formation of EMI Records , a division of Capitol Records .
#Text=Isgro was brought onto EMI to handle the promotion staff of the new label on the West Coast . [ 5 ]
#Text=In 1979 , he formed Isgro Enterprises , Inc. , an independent record promotion and consulting company .

#Text=Isgro promoted releases for several major labels including records by artists including Michael Jackson , Culture Club , Neil Diamond , Journey , Diana Ross , Paul Young , Lionel Richie , Dionne Warwick , Hall & Oates , Barbra Streisand , The Rolling Stones , Supertramp , Kenny Rogers , Sheena Easton , Wham ! , Bruce Springsteen , Kim Carnes , Chicago , Patti LaBelle , Phil Collins , Rod Stewart , U2 , David Bowie , Elton John , Madonna , George Michael , Janet Jackson and Paula Abdul . [ 6 ]
#Text=Isgro then developed Los Angeles Recording Company ( LARC ) , distributed through MCA Records .
#Text=LARC signed acts The Chi-Lites , The Dells , The Staple Singers and Bonnie Pointer .
#Text=Soon after the formation of LARC Records , Isgro established a second label , Private I Records , distributed through Columbia Records .
#Text=The first release of Private I Records was Matthew Wilder ’ s " Break My Stride " , which peaked at number one on the US chart position .
#Text=It would be the first of Private I 's 27 charting singles . [ 7 ]
#Text=In 1992 , Isgro produced the film Hoffa , starring Jack Nicholson , Danny DeVito and Armand Assante .
#Text=It was nominated for an Academy Award and a Golden Globe Award . [ 8 ]
#Text=Currently , Isgro is a producer at Raging Bull Productions His projects include the films Lucky Luciano , Pablo Escobar and The Stone Pony . [ 9 ]
#Text=Isgro secured the rights for the Luciano story in 2007 and the film is currently in pre-production . [ 10 ]
#Text=Legal trials

#Text=In September 1990 , Isgro and two other defendants were prosecuted for 57 counts of payola -related offenses , including racketeering , mail fraud , money laundering and obstruction of justice .
#Text=The case was dismissed by federal Judge James M. Ideman on grounds of " outrageous government misconduct " . [ 11 ]

column1: #Text=On March 25 , 2000 , Federal Bureau of Investigation agents and the Beverly Hills Police Department arrested the label owner and former independent promotion and charged him with a federal felony complaint of extortion . [ 12 ]
#Text=He was convicted [ 13 ] and sentenced to 50 months in federal prison .
#Text=According to an FBI affidavit , Isgro and a crew of collectors and enforcers extorted hundreds of thousands of dollars from scores of victims , charging interest rates of up to 5 % a week .
#Text=The loan sharking operation had been going on since 1994 , the FBI said . [ 14 ]

#Text=According to criminal complaints filed in the case , a Rancho Palos Verdes , California , man , Bernard Beyda , complained to Beverly Hills police in January that he was threatened after he had difficulty making " loan " payments , which included 5 % in weekly interest , to Saitta . [ 15 ]
#Text=On July 30 .
#Text=2014 , Isgro pleaded not guilty in New York State Supreme Court to charges of gambling , conspiracy , and money laundering .
#Text=He was released on $ 250,000 bail . [ 16 ]
